TEXT: The first applicant , Mr PERSON , was born in DATE . The second applicant , Mr PERSON , was born in DATE . Both being nationals of GPE , they live in GPE , GPE . They were represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in ORG . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by PERSON , Agent , ORG and Law Enforcement .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

In DATE the applicants took part in a motor - ORG meeting in ORG , GPE , organised in the park of an open - air swimming pool . They slept in a tent under a tree when , due to the heavy rain , a branch broke and fell on them causing them several injuries .
On DATE the first applicant instituted proceedings in the ORG seeking the payment of damages from the owner of the swimming pool , ORG . On DATE the second applicant filed a similar action .
The second applicant ’s case was stayed on DATE and statutorily ceased to exist on DATE . He reintroduced his claim on DATE .

Meanwhile , after having held CARDINAL hearings and suspending the proceedings at the parties’ request DATE and DATE , on DATE ORG dismissed the first applicant ’s action , holding that the respondent was not liable . The court relied largely on the opinions of CARDINAL experts . On DATE ORG dismissed the first applicant ’s appeal . On DATE ORG review bench quashed the first and second instance decisions and remitted the first applicant ’s case to ORG , holding that it had failed to examine whether the GPE had any contractual liability .

After several hearings held in the resumed proceedings and the joinder of the CARDINAL cases on DATE , on DATE ORG dismissed the applicants’ joint action , holding the respondent had neither contractual nor delictual liability .
On DATE ORG finally dismissed the applicants’ appeal .

On DATE ORG rejected the applicants’ petition for review as inadmissible , without examining it on the merits , observing that they had failed to specify any appropriate legal grounds for their motion , as required by CARDINAL of LAW . This decision was served on the ORG representative on DATE .
